meanings.definition: The soft, dense fur found beneath the longer outer fur of an animal.
meanings.sent1: The rabbit's underfur kept it warm during the cold winter months.
meanings.sent2: The underfur of the bear was thick and provided insulation.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel used its underfur to create a cozy nest.
meanings.sent4: The underfur of the seal was like a fluffy blanket protecting it from the icy waters.
meanings.sent5: The underfur felt like a cloud against the skin, so soft and comforting.

meanings.definition: The undercoat of fur on an animal.
meanings.sent1: The underfur of the cat was so fluffy and warm.
meanings.sent2: During shedding season, the underfur of the dog would cover the house.
meanings.sent3: The underfur of the hamster made it look like a tiny ball of fluff.
meanings.sent4: The underfur of the fox was a hidden treasure beneath its sleek outer coat.
meanings.sent5: The underfur felt like a secret layer of protection, unseen but vital.
